question: What is the KDEL retention signal?
ideal_answer: the -KDEL retention signal sequence is characteristic of many proteins localized to the ER.

snippets.text: By fusing the antibody with a KDEL retention signal, the interaction of antibodies and native membrane antigens occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum during the process of protein secretion
The KDEL retention signal led to the accumulation of PrP in the ER,
retained in the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) using a KDEL retention signal
These sequences are similar to the -KDEL retention signal sequence characteristic of many proteins localized to the ER.
